data.title: New JS files cause completion error
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.6.1
- OS Version: Windows 10

Every time I create a new JS file in my project, when I begin editing it, an error is thrown in the TypeScript console and Intellisense completions fail to work in that file. Restarting VS Code fixes the issue.

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Create project with at least one JS file and Intellisense enabled
2. Create new empty JS source file (ctrl + N, save)
3. Begin typing

**Stack trace:**

```
[Error - 11:39:35 PM] 'completions' request failed with error.
Error processing request. Cannot read property 'lineNumberToInfo' of undefined
TypeError: Cannot read property 'lineNumberToInfo' of undefined
    at LSHost.lineOffsetToPosition (c:\Program Files (x86)\Microsoft VS Code\resources\app\extensions\typescript\server\typescript\lib\tsserver.js:52031:37)
    at IOSession.Session.getCompletions (c:\Program Files (x86)\Microsoft VS Code\resources\app\extensions\typescript\server\typescript\lib\tsserver.js:51466:53)
    at Session.handlers.ts.createMap._a.(anonymous function) (c:\Program Files (x86)\Microsoft VS Code\resources\app\extensions\typescript\server\typescript\lib\tsserver.js:50859:50)
    at IOSession.Session.executeCommand (c:\Program Files (x86)\Microsoft VS Code\resources\app\extensions\typescript\server\typescript\lib\tsserver.js:51729:28)
    at IOSession.Session.onMessage (c:\Program Files (x86)\Microsoft VS Code\resources\app\extensions\typescript\server\typescript\lib\tsserver.js:51746:35)
    at Interface.<anonymous> (c:\Program Files (x86)\Microsoft VS Code\resources\app\extensions\typescript\server\typescript\lib\tsserver.js:53940:27)
    at emitOne (events.js:96:13)
    at Interface.emit (events.js:188:7)
    at Interface._onLine (readline.js:232:10)
    at Interface.<anonymous> (readline.js:365:12)
```

**jsconfig.json**

```
{
    "compilerOptions": {
        "target": "ES6",
        "module": "commonjs"
    },
    "exclude": [
        "node_modules/"
    ]
}
```

data.title: Command line tool on OS X could be faster
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.5.3
- OS Version: 10.11.6

Before I found out that you could install `code` in the path, I made this little shell script:

``` bash
#!/bin/sh
open -a 'visual studio code' "$@"
```

It tells VSCode to open the given files. It turns out that it is faster to run than the `code` command.

Steps to Test:
1. copy the above script into the path somewhere
2. run it with a file, note the speed
3. run `code` with the same file, note the speed

So… not sure if that means there should be anything done here.

data.title: debugServer property should be under configurations
data.body:
Currently the `debugServer` property in launch.json is at the same level of `version` - that is, it's global.
In my opinion it would make more sense for it to be under the specific configurations; the benefits would be:
- the extensions can fill launch.json appropriately (as far as I can see extensions can easily provide configurations when they are first clicked in the debug gear dropdown, but not global properties to launch.json)
- debug extensions using programs and ones using debugServer properties could be mixed-up in the same project 

Of course there is a high change that I'm missing something big - documentation about `debugServer` is hard to find and sparse, that being the case, sorry in advance :)

data.title: Let extensions force change language mode for a file
data.body:
I'm writing a new extension providing Hack language support. Hack files still have a .php extension, but start with `<?hh` instead of `<?php`. 

I added the following in the "hack" entry in the language contributes section in package.json:

``` json
    "extensions": [ ".php" ],
    "firstLine": "^<\\?hh\\b.*$"
```

However, all .php files in the workspace are still auto-detected as PHP, and the extension providers (registered with `const HACK_MODE: vscode.DocumentFilter = { language: 'hack', scheme: 'file' };`) aren't triggered unless the file mode is manually changed from PHP to Hack.

I'm not sure if I'm doing something wrong, or if PHP is still getting a higher precedence. Is there any way for an extension to force this change?

data.title: VSCode entirely unusable when opening a large project that contains both JS and TS

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.6.1
- OS Version: Ubuntu 14.04

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Open VSCode
2. Open a directory of large project that contains typescript and large js files
3. watch vscode crash and utterly die.
   - the errors that get thrown have been logged in many issues and closed many times (https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/4634, https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/762, https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/6375, https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/4438, https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/7238). This is obviously still a problem. I've tried all the workarounds that I could find posted in other issues and they never work.  Please don't close this until this is fixed.

Only workaround that actually works: 
1. open same directory in sublime and then edit code without any issues (albeit with inferior typescript and intellisense support)

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/5864474/19401445/a868a11a-9218-11e6-8709-c912790250ed.png)

data.title: Duplicate selected text or area

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.6.1
- OS Version: Windows 8.1 Enterprise 64-bit

Steps to Reproduce:
Hi,
This feature is best to speed up programming. (Please see below gif)
![milad](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/5067331/19399412/40a69d3e-925e-11e6-81be-4971a2f78d75.gif)

in vs code we can only duplicate lines by `Shift` + `Alt` + `Arrow up Or down`. But on this feature you can duplicate all things (selected characters, text , lines and ...)

**What's benefits?**
1. Do not use clipboard and you can save other things on clipboard and duplicate selected text or area.
2. Speed up programming.
3. Many developers previously worked with `notepad++` and now use `VS Code`. This feature is on `notepad++` and good to add this on vs code.

data.title: Non-distraction mode
data.body:
Feature Request

Brackets had a toggle non-distraction mode / hotkey: Quickly show/hide all side and bottom panels. Not a big thing but pretty useful.

data.title: Errors not shown inline when using keyboard only

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
_From @atombender on October 13, 2016 5:2_

On linter/build errors, the "Problems" panel is populated, and if you mouse over the error location there's a box shown after a delay. But there's no inline error shown when you have the cursor on the line where the error occurs. Compare VSCode:

![screen shot 2016-10-13 at 01 03 09](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/50314/19337201/da5db086-90e0-11e6-97e0-dff000c2d328.png)

And Atom with the go-plus plugin:

![screen shot 2016-10-13 at 01 00 35](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/50314/19337172/85dcf7f6-90e0-11e6-9f82-159cd0b4d703.png)

For me, Atom is a lot better here. I don't want to shift my focus to the "Problems" panel every time there's an error, and using the mouse isn't how I work in an editor.

Interestingly, the "go to next marker" keyboard shortcut (F8 by default) _does_ trigger an inline error description. But only then:

![screen shot 2016-10-13 at 01 06 01](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/50314/19337256/7af130e0-90e1-11e6-8bac-3b829085e852.png)

(That particular behaviour is a bit visually unsettling as it actually _inserts_ a line in the editor, rather than showing a floating tooltip. Inserting lines immediately on error would be fine, but it removes the line when you jump to the next error. It also doesn't go away if you fix the error.)

_Copied from original issue: Microsoft/vscode-go#527_

data.title: Avoiding "write EPIPE process.send" error on exit
data.body:
Repro steps:
- Add vscode-react-native extension,
- Run dev version of VS Code,
- Attach a debugger to the VS Code (Attach to Extension host),
- Close dev version of VS Code,
- Observe that [process.send(data)](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/blob/6681a2a7d6317cb8945e5ab1a69f6b8cbbae5053/src/vs/workbench/node/extensionHostProcess.ts#L34,L37) fails with `stack:"Error: write EPIPE
 at exports._errnoException (util.js:1026:11)
 at process.target._send (internal/child_process.js:654:20)
 at process.target.send (internal/child_process.js:538:19)
 at f:\coho\react-native\vscode\out\vs\workbench\node\file:\F:\coho\react-native\vscode\src\vs\workbench\node\extensionHostProcess.ts:40:13
 at sendAccumulated (f:\coho\react-native\vscode\out\vs\platform\extensions\common\file:\F:\coho\react-native\vscode\src\vs\platform\extensions\common\ipcRemoteCom.ts:257:3)
 at _combinedTickCallback (internal/process/next_tick.js:67:7)
 at process._tickCallback (internal/process/next_tick.js:98:9)"` error.

Steps to Reproduce:

2.  find "fontFamily"
3. was expecting a result that would allow me to change the fonts for the non-editor parts such as the file lists and the tab labels.

Though I would think that CSS would be better to set those up.

```
workbench editor {
   font: ...
}

workbench tab:active {
   font: ...
}
```

data.title: Multiple consecutive identical dialogs
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.6.1
- OS Version: macOS Sierra 10.12.1 Beta

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Open a file
2. Make some changes
3. Repeat N times `cmd+w`
4. Close the dialog
5. The same dialog will be opened N -1 more times
